alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:56PM EST until January 11 at 5:18AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Philadelphia, Montgomery and Chester Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Norristown...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. At 16.0 feet, The Upper Merion Boathouse starts to flood. At 17.0 feet, A couple industries along the river begin to have flood problems. Water begins to cover rails in Conshohocken. Septa tracks at Mogees in Plymouth Township begin to flood. Ross Street in Plymouth Township at the Sewer Authority Plant floods under the railroad bridge and bike trail. Flooding also occurs along Diamond Run at Station Road (in Plymouth Township off of Conshohocken Road) due to high and backwater effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Tuesday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 07/12/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 13.8 Tue 10 p 13.4 11.0 17.1 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM EST.
